headline: Mane in rage over Mo pass
content_plain:
Mane in rage over Mo pass By NEIL CUSTIS SADIO MANE was raging after being
subbed in Liverpool's win at Turf Moor. Mane (right) was taken off on 85
minutes, just after Mo Salah failed to pass to him with the goal gaping.
Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp admitted: "There was a situation in the game he Turn
to Page 47 Burnley................... 0 Liverpool................ 3 From Back
Page was not happy about it. He was upset, that is obvious. "He can't hide his
emotion. Would he do it like this again, probably not. He is completely fine and
everything is good and we completely like each other. "Sadio is an emotional
guy, we are all individuals. Something went not like he wanted, it is not the
substitution." Asked if it was about a pass he wanted to receive Klopp said
'yeah'. As the Senegal star sat on the bench he was seen shouting at a member of
the club staff and gesticulating wildly. Despite that incident Klopp was
delighted as Liverpool set a new club record of 13 consecutive league wins,
beating the mark set by Kenny Dalglish's title-winning side in 1990. Klopp
added: "Very early when I came in I told everyone we want to create our own
history and that is what the boys do week in, week out." Burnley boss Sean Dyche
was full of praise for the Reds. He said: "When they get their moments they hurt
you. They are clinical and so good in the transition. They and City are the
best." MANE IN A RAGE MAKING HIS POINT ... hotshot Mane looks unhappy after
being taken off by Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp

headline: BAND BOMB FURY
content_plain:
By SARAH RIDLEY FAMILIES of Manchester Arena bomb victims have slammed The 1975
for a pop video showing their frontman exploding a fake suicide vest.

Singer Matt Healy, 30, whose band is based in the English city and last night
rocked the main stage at Electric Picnic, smiles as he presses the detonator.

The sick stunt comes two years after a suicide bomber killed 22 people at an
Ariana Grande concert.

Alex Klis, 21, whose parents are among the dead, told the Irish Sun on Sunday:
"I expect better, especially from somebody who is from Manchester. Putting
yourself in a suicide vest is so insensitive.

"Terrorist attacks are not something you use to make a music video look 'cool'."

Figen Murray, whose son Martyn Hett, 29, was killed: added: "I can't believe
anybody could think this is in any way acceptable. It is disgusting."

Healy, 30  son of ex-Corrie star Denise Welch, 61  filmed the video with his
bandmates for their latest single People.

Last weekend, The 1975 were headlining Reading and Leeds festivals while Ariana,
26, performed at Manchester Pride.

The band's management have been approached for comment.

headline: Multiple people shot by '2 gunmen'
content_plain:
By CRAIG FARRELL AT least 30 people were shot last night, including a state
trooper, in two separate attacks in west Texas, according to reports.

There were also reports that at least one person was killed.

Two depraved shooters were believed to have carried out the attacks in Midland
and Odessa.

Midland Police said that the shooters were understood to be travelling in two
separate vehicles.

A statement released late last night read: "We believe there are two shooters in
two separate vehicles. One suspect is believed to be at the Cinergy in Midland
and the other is believed to be driving in Midland.

"The two vehicles in question are a gold/white small Toyota truck and a USPS
postal van. Please stay indoors."

Midland and Odessa are in West Texas, about 20 miles apart.

headline: 1 killed & 9 injured by knife attacker
content_plain:
By ALAHNA KINDRED ONE person was killed and nine others were injured after a
knifemen went on a rampage in France yesterday.

Cops confirmed a 33-year-old man from Afghanistan was arrested after the attack
at 4.30pm local time at a bus stop outside the Laurent Bonnevay metro station in
Villeurbanne, near Lyon.

A kitchen knife and sharp spit  used for roasting meat  were said to be found
by detectives.

A police source said the attacker targeted a 19-year-old man who died at the
scene.

The source said: "It seemed to be entirely random. As the attack intensified he
was jumped by four bus conductors who managed to get the kitchen knife off him."

It's understood cops launched a manhunt for a second attacker but later
determined the detained man was the main suspect. One victim was in intensive
care.

headline: 'Killa' gets his Groove on
content_plain:
By CRAIG FARRELL STRADBALLY will be left with a massive leccy bill  as Electric
Picnic lights up last night.

Punters had a rip-roaring time as former Ireland star Kevin Kilbane put in a
winning performance as he made his festival DJ set debut last night at the
event.

DJ 'Killa' scored on the big stage as he was supported by Groove Armada during a
surprise guest appearance in Co Laois.

And while music lovers had to deal with a small flurry of showers during the
second day of the festival, the showers were quick to skedaddle.

U2 frontman Bono was on hand to watch his 20-year-old son Elijah Hewson's band
Inhaler perform on the Rankin's Wood Stage  with the pair spotted swapping tips
backstage.

headline: F2 STAR DEATH SMASH HORROR
subheadline: MOTORSPORT IN MOURNING 150 mph tragedy after Spa qualifying
content_plain:
By BEN HUNT MOTORSPORT was plunged into mourning after Anthoine Hubert was
killed at the Belgian Grand Prix.

The Frenchman, 22, died as a result of his injuries following a sickening 150mph
crash at the famous Eau Rogue turn at Spa.

It happened on the second lap on the F2 race after Formula One qualifying
finished. Hubert's car crashed heavily into the barriers and sprung back on to
the race track and was struck by Juan Manuel Correa, who was travelling behind
and had no chance of swerving out of the way.

Correa's car ripped through Hubert's Arden, splitting it in two. Race stewards
stopped and cancelled the race, while marshals and medics raced to help.

Hubert (below), who won the GP3 championship last season, was part of the
Renault Academy.

A statement from the sport's governing body said: "The FIA regrets to advise
that a serious incident involving cars 12, 19 and 20 occurred at 17:07 on August
31 as a part of the FIA Formula 2 Feature Race at Spa-Francorchamps. The scene
was immediately attended by emergency and medical crews, and all drivers were
taken to the medical centre.

"As a result of the incident, the FIA regrets to inform that the driver of car
#19, Antoine Hubert, succumbed to his injuries, and passed away at 18:35."

American driver Correa was said to be in a stable condition and being treated in
hospital as a result of his leg injuries.

Hubert is the first person to die as a result of injuries at a Grand Prix
meeting since Frenchman Jules Bianchi at the 2014 Japanese GP.

Bianchi crashed at Suzuka and died nine months later in a Nice hospital at the
age of 25. F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton was being interviewed when he
watched in shock as Hubert's car collided with Correa.

Hamilton, 34, wrote on Instagram: "This is devastating. God rest your soul
Anthoine. My prayers and thoughts are with you and your family.

"If a single one of you watching and enjoying this sport think for a second what
we do is safe, you're highly mistaken.

"All the drivers put their lives on the line when they hit the track and people
need to appreciate that in a serious way because it is not appreciated enough.

"Not from the fans nor some of the people actually working in the sport.
"Anthoine is a hero for taking the risk he did to chase his dreams. I'm so sad.
Rest in peace brother." The tragedy casts a huge cloud over today's F1 race
where Ferrari's Charles Leclerc starts on pole after Hamilton crashed during
final practice.

The British racer spun twice in the German GP while he crashed during final
practice at Spa meaning his team had a race against time to repair his car for
qualifying.

Hamilton then almost crashed into his team-mate Valtteri Bottas  who he leads
by 62 points in the standings  in a crazy qualifying that was stopped twice due
to engine fires.

Hamilton (left) said: "I'm only human, it happens sometimes. It was a massive
challenge for the team to rebuild my car. They did a great job."

Hamilton will start in third behind Sebastian Vettel and Leclerc.

headline: Nadal makes kneesy work of Chung test
content_plain:
RAFAEL NADAL made it look kneesy as he powered past Chung Hyeon and into the US
Open fourth round.

The Spanish second seed  who had a walkover in the previous round  had not
played since Tuesday and it showed in a dominant 6-3 6-4 6-2 win. Nadal
dispensed with the tape he usually has strapped around his knees for the victory
over the South Korean at Arthur Ashe Stadium.

He explained: "The tape is not working any more. But I'm happy to be playing on
the hard court. I'm trying to play a bit more aggressive.

"I'm happy to be in the fourth round one more time."

In contrast to Nadal's easy week, Chung had come through three rounds of
qualifying and spent nine hours more on court.

Asked about the potential benefit of a comfortable opening week in which he has
only had to play two matches, Nadal added: "You never know, last year I had some
tough matches and then in the semi-finals I had to retire against Juan Martin
Del Potro.

"You never know what's better."

Up next for Nadal is 14th seed John Isner or 2014 champion Marin Cilic.

He added: "I have a tough opponent, John Isner or Marin Cilic.

"I need to be ready, I can't think further than this."

Meanwhile, Martina Navratilova reckons Jo Konta is playing at the peak of her
powers as she aims for a first Major crown.

Konta who reached the French Open semis and Wimbledon last eight this year,
faces world No 3 Karolina Pliskova today in the US Open last 16.

Her performances in New York have been top notch, impressing 18-time Slam winner
Navratilova.

The all-time great was particularly blown away by her third-round straight-sets
destruction of China's Zhang Shuai on Friday and said: "She looked great.

"Everything was working  I think she had a very specific game plan.

"She really went for the right shots at the right time. It was an A-plus
performance.

"It seems like she's playing more on instinct now  she knows what she wants to
do and doesn't have to think about it. Because of that I think she's cut out the
unforced errors."

headline: Zouma hit by vile fan abuse
content_plain:
Chelsea.............. 2 Sheffield Utd.....2 KURT ZOUMA suffered racial abuse
after scoring an own goal which denied Frank Lampard his first Chelsea home win.

The French defender turned the ball into his own net with less than a minute
remaining  prompting a stream of vile comments on Twitter.

Zouma was labelled 'n*****' and a 'f****** black s***' as the social media
platform came under the spotlight again.

Centre-back Zouma is the second Blues star this season to be targeted by his own
fans.

Tammy Abraham was also singled out for missing a penalty in the Uefa Super Cup
final against Liverpool.

Boss Lampard said: "I'm probably going over the same ground as I did with Tammy.

"Firstly, it is the person who does it  whatever they are hiding from.

"Secondly, we have to look at social media and the platforms and give them
accountability, so people who register can be chased down for it.

"It's simple. We're all going to get tired of talking about it. This has to be
dealt with.

"We have plans to do that. Everyone knows from the way I speak, and way the club
acts, where we want to go with it. With any player."

Chelsea are planning to hold talks with Twitter to try to weed out a problem
which is not just restricted to their club.

England women's head coach Phil Neville called for a Twitter boycott to force
them to police postings better.

Lampard blamed his whole team for ignoring warnings about slacking off on the
pitch.

Chelsea blew a twogoal lead and have now conceded NINE GOALS in four league
games since he took over in the summer.

Abraham's double had the Blues cruising before Callum Robinson netted for
Sheffield United and then Zouma put through his own net.

Lampard said: "We switched off in a game we should be comfortably seeing out at
2-0 up  and that's no disrespect to Sheffield United.

"It's not defence, it's conceding as a team."

Rookie midfielder Billy Gilmour, 18, was handed his Blues debut late on.

Lampard said: "I've got faith in Billy. He is going to have a big future. We
have a transfer ban, so the squad is what it is."

headline: POG DAY AFTERNOON
subheadline:
SOUTHAMPTON 1 MANCHESTER UNITED 1 Solskjaer backs misfiring star and insists:
Paul is not going to be leaving
content_plain:
OLE GUNNAR SOLSKJAER claimed Paul Pogba will NOT be making a last-minute move
from Manchester United.

Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane, who has been trying to sign his fellow
Frenchman all summer, said he would spring one or two "surprises" before the
European transfer window closes on Monday night.

But United boss Solskjaer said: "Paul Pogba will be playing for us."

The Norwegian also defended Pogba's role in the 1-1 draw with ten-man
Southampton at St Mary's, which means United have made their worst start to a
season since 1992.

They scored first through Daniel James but their passing became sloppy to allow
Southampton back into it, Pogba being the worst culprit.

Solskjaer added: "I think as a team after about half an hour we started giving
sloppy balls away.

"Paul was one of them but he wasn't any different to anyone else. As a team we
didn't play well.

"In the last half an hour, he did create loads for us going forward.

"Everyone expects everything from him in every game.

"He has to defend, he has to attack, he has to win headers, he has to win
tackles, he has to dribble, he has to make passes.

"That's just Paul and he'll thrive on that." Pogba limped off with an ankle
injury but Solskjaer expects him to join up with France for international duty.

The draw, United's third game without a win since the opening weekend thumping
of Chelsea, means they have just five points from four games.

Back in 1992-93, Alex Ferguson's side managed four points yet went on to win the
title.

There is no hope of Solskjaer's side pulling off the same feat.

But he insisted they are moving in the right direction as he bids to return to
the club's tradition of playing on the front foot rather than counter-attacking.

He said: "You can say it's a long-term plan but we deserved to win the last
three games as well.

"We dominated the last three games and we know we are on the right track,
getting used to that way of playing.

"The one thing you cannot control in football is results and outcomes.

"You can keep control of the effort, the attitude, what we're doing in training.

"We're on the right track, we're working.

"And, as I said to the boys, we have to learn to win these games.

"I know we are a young team but that's not an excuse. We have plenty of
quality."

United were pegged back by Jannik Vestergaard's towering header for Saints.

And former Red Devils and England defender Rio Ferdinand was critical of their
defence as Victor Lindelof was beaten in the air for the second game in a row.

Ferdinand said: "They'll be disappointed with that. The defeat against Palace
and this today doesn't look great.

"They had Southampton by the scruff of the neck and they were there for the
taking.

"They let them off the hook and that will be the disappointing thing for the
management.

"They've had one clean sheet in 19 games and that tells you everything you need
to know.

"They need to be more commanding.

"They look weak at set-pieces and were undone by a another one.

"Far too often United haven't got it right defensively. At no point do the
defenders get tight to Vestergaard, who gets a free run.

"They are passing the buck. This is about personal pride, 'Am I doing all I
can?'."

United's shining light was once again summer signing James.

The Wales international, 21, struck a brilliant tenth-minute goal to make it
three in four games and was his team's most consistent threat.

Solksjaer added: "He's come in and made an impact ever since day one in
training.

"I think he's an example to everyone in football.

"He's had his period of loans and didn't get games.

"Now he is our top scorer and that comes through in his personality and his
habits.

"He's humble and works hard.

He knows he can improve.

"He could have scored one or two more today and we will work with him to get his
quality even higher.

"We will have a top player there."

Southampton head coach Ralph Hasenhuttl was delighted with the way his side held
out after defender Kevin Danso was sent off for a second bookable offence.

The Austrian said: "I'm very proud of my team and of our stadium and the crowd,
how they pushed us at the end and energised us.

"It was very important after this tough week, with this third game in a week and
injuries, then the red card.

"In the end, it was only about the character and mentality of our team.

"And the guys showed it and deserved to get this point."

MANCHESTER UNITED had a penalty turned down late on but it was a tough call for
ref Mike Dean.

Did Southampton midfielder Stuart Armstrong play the ball? No. Did Armstrong
make contact with United forward Mason Greenwood (above)? Yes. If Dean had given
a penalty at St Mary's then VAR would not have overturned the decision because
it was a subjective decision and not a clear and obvious error. The official was
in an excellent position  and in real time I can understand why he did not
think it was a penalty.

headline: DANIIL'S A DEVIL TO FURIOUS FANS
content_plain:
DANIIL MEDVEDEV was booed off court  and loved every minute.

The Russian sent a rowdy US Open crowd crazy during a 7-6 4-6 7-6 6-4 win over
Feliciano Lopez to reach the fourth round.

Medvedev, 23, angrily grabbed a towel from a ballboys and threw his racket after
getting a code violation. He then gave a one-fingered salute to the umpire  who
missed it.

He told the crowd: "I want all of you to know when you sleep tonight  I won
because of you."

NOVAK DJOKOVIC told a fan to 'shut the f*** up' in his 6-3 6-4 6-2 win over
DENIS KUDLA.

headline: IT'S COADY'S TIME
content_plain:
Everton v Wolves 2pm JESUS VALLEJO reckons he could be going up against
team-mate Conor Coady one day  with the Wolves skipper in an England shirt.

Real Madrid star Vallejo is on loan at Molineux this season and has ambitions to
become Spain regular.

And if they play England, he hopes fellow defender Coady is in their line-up.

Vallejo (left), 22, believes Coady sets an example to the rest of the squad at a
time when Wolves will be looking to avoid the sort of Europa League burnout that
hampered Burnley last season.

Coady, 26, has played every minute of the past 74 matches for Wolves.

And he has led them into the group stages of the Europa League just five years
after they were a League One side.

But England boss Gareth Southgate has yet to select Coady, who comes from a
family of Liverpool supporters and is set to go up against Everton this
afternoon.

Vallejo said: "Conor's a very good captain. From the first day I came here, he
was good with me. And he plays every game! He plays Saturday, Thursday, Saturday
again. He's a great example as a professional.

"I would like it if he played for England. And I'd be very proud if they started
with him in the England team and I was playing against him for Spain!" Vallejo
reckons unbeaten Wolves wlll attack this season "like a pack" after setting up
what could be a strong campaign.

So far Vallejo has only been used in three European ties by boss Nuno Espirito
Santo but could make his Premier League debut at Goodison today. He added: "For
me and the team, it was very important to get through to the group stages of the
Europa League.

"Everyone has their part to play in this squad. We're like a pack!

"I am ready to start in the team if picked. I am here to play in the Premier
League but I arrived one month later than everyone else.

"When Nuno called me, Real Madrid said yes straight away.

"They knew from the first moment  this club is very good for me and for my
development. It was the best option for me.

"In Spain, they know the job Nuno is doing here. Real have a good relationship
with Wolves." LIKELY LINE-UPS  EVERTON: Pickford, Coleman Mina, Keane, Digne,
Bernard, Gomes, Sigurdsson, Schneiderlin, Richarlison, Kean.

WOLVES: Patricio, Boly, Coady, Bennett, Jonny, Traore, Moutinho, Neves,
Dendoncker, Jimenez, Jota.

headline: Scouts out as United brace for De Gea exit
content_plain:
MANCHESTER UNITED spies are scouring Europe for keepers  fuelling fears David
De Gea could be sold in January.

De Gea, 28, has still not signed United's offer of a new deal, worth around
£350,000 a week, despite months of talks.

It means he could leave Old Trafford for nothing when his contract expires at
the end of the season.

If United are not at least challenging for the top four by the turn of the year,
De Gea will almost certainly want away.

While the club are still desperate to keep the Spaniard, insiders believe he
will be sold in the next window, to avoid missing out on a hefty fee.

Atletico Madrid's Slovenia keeper Jan Oblak, 26, is a long-standing target.

But United also like Dinamo Zagreb No 1 Dominik Livakovic, 24. De Gea's form
dipped last season but United believe they would still get around £30million,
with moneybags Paris Saint-Germain interested.

headline: Keith Trots back home
content_plain:
BOLTON'S new owners have given local lad Keith Hill the manager's job and the
chance to bring them back from the dead.

Hill (below) was born in the town and has vast experience with Rochdale and
Barnsley.

He faces a massive task to rebuild after the Trotters suffered a THIRD 5-0
bashing of the season away at Gillingham yesterday, on top of a 12-point
deduction.

Football Ventures finally took over the club last week, saving them from
liquidation.

Hill will be joined in the dugout by assistant boss David Flitcroft, who also
hails from Bolton.

Hill, 50, told the club website: "David and I are extremely grateful for the
opportunity to manage our home-town club.

"My first job is to recruit a number of players ahead of Monday's deadline.

"The young lads have done really well but we need to strengthen the squad."

Meanwhile, SunSport can reveal a PFA loan of about £2million to help the
takeover is guaranteed by a property deal.

headline: IT TAKES 2 TO TANGO
content_plain:
STACEY Dooley and her pro dance partner Kevin Clifton are not the first Strictly
duo to add some extra magic to the mix with their sizzling chemistry ...

SOAP star Kara Tointon, 36, and dancer Artem Chigvintsev, 37, won the
Glitterball Trophy after falling for each other on the show in 2010. They stayed
together for three years.

RUGBY ace Ben Cohen, 40, lasted to week nine in 2013 thanks to dance ace
Kristina Rihanoff, 41. He later got divorced and now has a daughter, aged three,
with Kristina.

CORRIE actress Georgia May Foote, 28, was swayed by 28-year-old Giovanni
Pernice's charms in 2015, and the pair made the final. They went on to date for
almost a year.

YOUTUBER Joe Sugg, 27, and dancer Dianne Buswell, 30, narrowly lost out to
Stacey and Kevin in last year's final. They also became a couple and are
planning to move in together.

headline: 600 hours of training to thank for victory
content_plain:
BY the time Stacey Dooley lifted the trophy last year she had endured almost 600
hours of gruelling training.

Weeks before the final she was taken to hospital after tearing an intercostal
muscle behind her rib, and almost vomited from the pain.

Two days later she was back rehearsing and scored 36 out of 40 that week.

Stacey was not what you would call a natural dancer.

She even considered quitting after a disastrous score for her cha cha cha in
week two, before doggedly deciding to carry on.

So how frustrated she must have been on Friday to hear her triumph apparently
put down to her "sleeping with her dance partner" rather than her work ethic.

Craig Revel Horwood's snide remark will have also cut deep for Kevin Clifton -
who put in just as many hours alongside Stacey.

He had reached no fewer than four finals before finally being crowned.

So the suggestion that he too slept his way to the top will add a bitter taste.

There's no doubt that the pair's chemistry helped them along their path to
glory.

But as an experienced judge, Craig should know better than to brush away the
blood, sweat and tears that really won the trophy.

headline: 2 RIOT ARRESTS
content_plain:
2 RIOT ARRESTS TWO men have been arrested after a protest against an Irish unity
march sparked a riot in Scotland.

Riot police, officers on horseback, a force helicopter and dog units were used
to quell the "significant disorder" in Govan, Glasgow, on Friday.

Officers said the planned march, organised by the James Connolly Republican
Flute Band, was met by hundreds of "disruptive" protestors at around 7pm.

Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon called the incident "unacceptable".
Cops said the men held over the alleged public disorder raps are aged 37 and 21.

headline: CRAIG GROVEL HORWOOD
subheadline:
EXCLUSIVE: STRICTLY STAR APOLOGY OVER SEX JIBE Backstage . . Kevin, Di & Stacey
with your dance partner that helps7 lTV judge admits: I made huge error "I'm
deeply sorry for cruel comments and
byline: By LAURA ARMSTRONG Sunday Showbiz Editor
content_plain:
STRICTLY'S Craig Revel Horwood issued a grovelling apology last night after
saying celebs should sleep with their pro partners like Stacey Dooley to win.

The acid-tongued judge, 54, admitted he had made a "huge error" and he deeply
regretted his "hurtful" jibe, made during filming on Friday night.

Last year's champ Stacey  now dating former dance partner Kevin Clifton  was
sitting in the audience with her family at the time. Filming was halted as aides
rushed over to them, but her mum Di stormed from the Strictly studio.

BBC sources said Craig was savaged by bosses for the "totally unacceptable"
remark  and ordered to apologise.

Craig said last night: "I'm deeply sorry for the offence caused to Kevin and
Stacey and everyone who works on the show.

"I recognise that what I said was hurtful, cruel and incredibly disrespectful.
It was a huge error of judgment that I very much regret."

It came after reigning champions Stacey and Kevin took to the ballroom floor
during filming for the pre-recorded launch show, which will be aired next
weekend.

Following their performance, host Tess Daly asked the panel  Craig, Bruno
Tonioli, Shirley Ballas and newcomer Motsi Mabuse  for their advice to this
year's contestants.

Craig initially told her the wannabes should be inspired by documentary-maker
Stacey, 32.

He said she had been "dragged up from the dance gutter" before winning the show.

But he then added spitefully: "Of course, if you sleep with your dance partner
that helps..."

Sources said the snide remark sent shockwaves around the studio, and horrified
bosses immediately called for filming to be halted.

Worried aides flocked to Stacey and her family while executive producers
immediately decided to scrap the footage.

The hosts, panel and audience were then asked to return to their places to
refilm the sequence.

One source said: "It was an awful moment. Craig was obviously trying to be
funny, but realised as soon as he said it that he had gone too far.

"The audience was visibly shocked, as was Tess Daly and the other judges.

"Immediately after he made the comment, 'cut' was called, and chaos broke out.

"Several aides rushed over to Stacey and her family to check if they were OK.
They were all stunned, and Stacey's mum obviously wasn't OK at all.

"She looked very upset, and soon after that she left the studio.

"The bosses were absolutely furious with Craig and wasted no time in taking him
to one side afterwards and telling him the remark was totally unacceptable.

"They encouraged him to make a full apology to Stacey and Kevin, which he was
happy to do.

"He knows that what he said was completely out of line."

The launch show for this year's series will be screened on BBC1 next Saturday.

Days before filming, Stacey had shared her excitement about returning to
Strictly on social media with a series of photographs backstage. One, showing
her having her hair done, was retweeted by proud mum Di.

And boyfriend Kevin, 36, posted a heart emoji underneath the shot.

The Irish Sun on Sunday revealed in April how Stacey was secretly dating the
dancer after ditching her long-term boyfriend Sam Tucknott.

The pair were said to have grown close while filming the show, with their
on-screen chemistry helping them sail through to the final last December.

After winning the trophy, Stacey gushed about her partner: "I should say
something quite poignant, shouldn't I? You know how highly I think of you. I
think you are the biggest gem. It's no surprise you have been in the final as
many times as you have.

"It's daunting doing something you haven't done before. But he's so patient and
he walks you through. You so deserve this."

Kevin replied: "Thank you so much, not just for being so amazing and for dancing
so well, but for being the most wonderful person to work with, to spend every
day training with.

"You've worked so hard. You are so lovely and I think the absolute world of
you."

Kevin supported Stacey as she performed on the Strictly Come Dancing Live tour 
despite not taking part himself. In January they were seen apparently sharing a
hotel date in Birmingham.

Stacey and personal trainer Sam, 30, ended their five-year relationship in
March.

But Sam got a shock when the pair cleared out their Brighton flat on April 1. He
spotted a text from Kevin on Stacey's phone which read: "I love you."

Stacey, who has a €270,000-ayear golden handcuffs deal with the BBC, later
texted Sam to insist she had only fallen for Kevin once the couple had
separated.

But her explanation failed to reassure Sam, who branded Kevin a "rat" and a
"snake". Stacey and Kevin's relationship has since gone from strength to
strength.

In July, Stacey broke her silence on the romance to gush about "amazing" Kevin 
who was previously married to Strictly pro Karen Clifton.

She told a newspaper: "What I am happy to say is, 'Kev's amazing, I'm happy,
life happens, I've got an amazing career and I'm very lucky.'" A BBC source said
last night of the judge's comment: "Craig was told in no uncertain terms that
this was completely unacceptable.

"It goes against everything the show stands for and it's right that he's issued
a full apology."

@IrishSunOnline

WHAT HE SAID TO TESS 6Stacey was dragged up from the dance gutter..of course, if
you sleep with your dance partner that helps7

headline: Docs said not to tell Mum that Dad died...she worked it out
subheadline: EXCLUSIVE: KING LOSES BOTH PARENTS IN A MONTH
content_plain:
TELLY star Martin King today reveals the double heartbreak he suffered losing
both parents within the space of a month.

Mum Christina Boyle, lost her battle with dementia just over four weeks after
his father, Martin Boyle, died suddenly in Dublin's Beaumont Hospital on Easter
Monday.

Speaking for the first time about his heartbreaking loss, Martin, 56, told the
Irish Sun on Sunday: "It's been tough, very tough.

"My mother died four weeks and a day after my dad passed away. In the weeks
after they'd both gone, I felt like it wasn't me going through all this.

"Then the reality of it would sink in, it was me. That both my mum and dad were
gone. That this had actually happened."

Grieving Six O'Clock Show host Martin has revealed the turmoil he faced after
being told not to tell his mother, who was in hospital with dementia, that his
dad had died.

He said: "My dad was fine up to that. We were expecting my mother to die. Then
my dad died suddenly.

"We were told by doctors not to tell my mother that my dad had died so we
didn't.

"We didn't say anything to her about it. The strange thing is that my mother
worked it out.

"You see even when people are suffering from dementia, they can suddenly have
moments of clarity and that's what happened. My mother woke up one day and put
two and two together.

"She told us, 'Your dad hasn't come in to see me in the hospital and he hasn't
been in a very long time.' She worked out that he had died. Then it was just two
days later that she died herself."

Mam Christina  or Chrissie  passed away at the TLC Carton Nursing Home in
Raheny, Dublin surrounded by her family.

And Martin added: "Because at my father's funeral, we'd asked for no flowers and
only donations towards Dementia Research, people thought dad had dementia.

"But he'd been fine, my mother was the one suffering from dementia. Now I'd lost
them both."

Popular presenter Martin paid tribute to his photographer wife Jenny for getting
him through the month of hell along with his family in Virgin Media TV.

Previously writing on social media, Jenny said: "There really are no words ...
Martin's beautiful, beautiful mam and my second mam, Chrissie, has left this
world one month and one day after losing her husband, Martin's dad.

"I guess he just wanted her with him again. Two beautiful souls back together
forever. Life will never, ever be the same but their love for each other lives
on in their children and grandchildren."

But Martin admits he had to be talked out of going back to work too soon after
their deaths.

He said: "I tried to go back to work a week after my dad died and then I
realised I'd be working on the same day he died the previous week, I'm glad I
took another day out.

"Then when my mother died, (Virgin Media boss) Pat Kiely and the team were
fantastic and said take a few weeks off, which I did, and it helped."

The Q102 host said Michael Buble played a key role in his grieving when he went
to see him play at Dublin's 3Arena in early June.

Martin said: "The first night out I had with Jenny after my parents died was a
Michael Buble concert.

"The gig was fantastic then right out of the blue in the middle, Michael started
talking about the BIG Buble's helped recent death of his grandfather who lived
to be 92.

was say "He said when he told people his grandfather had died and what age he
was, they'd say, 'He lived to a right old age and you had a great time
together'. Michael said he thought that was bulls**t, as he wanted those good
times with his grandfather to just keep going and going."

GIG Martin's real name  just like story Martin's dad  is Martin Boyle. But
Martin Jnr was forced to change his name early on because of the duo's
respective careers.

He previously said: "When I was 15 I started working for the Big D, which was a
pirate radio station.

"I took the position to earn money while my father was in hospital. But once I
got the chance to present he was already out of hospital, thank God. At the time
he worked in the Post and Telegraph service, and his job was to shut down pirate
radio stations."

At the time it was policy in his father's line of work for anyone with relatives
working in an illegal radio station to be suspended.

So when the opportunity came for Martin to host his show, he had a discussion
with his producer over what his pseudonym would be.

He added: "I said I'll stick with my birth name but I couldn't use Boyle, so we
discussed it for a bit.

"The producer asked me, 'Who are your idols?' But Martin Best, Cruyff and Ali
didn't sound right.

"Eventually I said Martin Luther King, but obviously I couldn't use Luther, so
we went for Martin King. The rest is history."

The working class Dub also revealed how he almost quit his job starting out as a
DJ working for Sunshine FM.

The broadcaster told how he was asked by his station manager to split from his
friends in the Edenmore estate in north Dublin where he grew up.

Martin explained: "I remember a manager at the station telling me that the only
way I could succeed was for me to leave the area I grew up in and all my
friends.

"You had to sound like you were drowning somewhere in the mid-Atlantic, and of
course everyone was hiding their regional accent at the time to try and improve
their diction.

"In hindsight he may have been looking out for my best interests, but I was a
young lad and I didn't want to leave the area  so I left the station instead."

Martin is one of the longest surviving faces on Virgin Media, formerly known as
TV3.

And fans of Ireland's most famous weatherman will be delighted to see him
featuring so prominently along with pal Alan Hughes in the new autumn promos for
the station.

This comes after long-standing colleagues of similar vintage, Mark Cagney and
Aidan Cooney, exited Ireland AM and the station.

Cagney, 63, stepped down from the show earlier in July after two decades
presenting. Cooney also left the station earlier this year.

Quizzed if he ever felt he could be next, Martin said: "No. I've never felt
that. I was sad to see Mark go but thrilled to hear him covering the breakfast
show on Newstalk.

"The young folks don't know that Mark was and is the king of radio. This is part
three for Mark and I'll be listening in." @KenSweeney

headline: THUGS SHOOT GARDA MOTOR
content_plain:
A MARKED Garda van with two female cops inside was shot up by thugs who were
trying to provoke a chase.

The vehicle was blasted in Buttercup Park, Darndale, north Dublin, at around
11.20pm on Thursday night.

The two gardai heard a loud noise while driving  before the suspect car took
off across a nearby field in the direction of the Malahide Road.

The officers initially thought they may have been rammed by the car.

It's understood when gardai are targeted like this, they must return to their
stations to examine the damage rather than do it at the scene.

And when they arrived back to the cop shop some time later, they found two
bullet holes on the driver's side door.

A representative body last night said this once again highlights the need for
mandatory sentencing for the vicious yobs behind such attacks.

Garda Representative Association vice president Frank Thornton told the Irish
Sun on Sunday: "It's another example of the very real dangers we face as members
of An Garda Siochana on a daily basis. The behaviour is deplorable. It's getting
out of control. It reiterates the GRA's policy that there needs to be mandatory
sentencing for all assaults and attacks on gardai."

The van has now been removed for technical and forensic examination.

Locals claim they heard up to five gunshots after seeing the Garda vehicle in
the area.

Last night, a Garda spokesman said: "No one was injured and both Garda members
involved remained on duty. The van has since been removed for technical and
forensic examination.

"Investigating gardai are appealing for witnesses.

"Anyone with information is asked to contact the incident room at Coolock Garda
Station 01 6664 200 or the Garda Confidential Line 1800 666 111."

@IrishSunOnline

headline: HEARTACHE FOR COLEEN
content_plain:
ROONEY'S antics with women have caused wife Coleen plenty of sleepless nights.

In 2004, the then teenage star allegedly cheated on her with prostitute
Charlotte Glover.

He also visited a Liverpool brothel and slept with granny Patricia Tierney, 48,
and has also reportedly slept with prostitute Gina McCarrick, 37.

In July 2009, call girl Jenny Thompson claims Rooney slept with her just a month
before Coleen had their first son, Kai.

In 2011 it was reported that Rooney had a threesome with Jenny and prostitute
Helen Wood and in September 2017 he was seen in a car with Laura Simpson. Rooney
was arrested for driving her motor while he was drunk.

Jenny Thompson ... and Helen Wood

headline: Ed 'could become a dad on his break'
content_plain:
ED Sheeran could be hoping for the pitter patter of tiny feet soon.

The singer has just wrapped his worldwide Divide tour and is set to take a long
break  and maybe start a family with wife Cherry Seaborn.

His manager Stuart Camp said: "He won't sit still for long. He's not the holiday
sort. But things may change  he could have a young family relatively soon."

The Shape of You singer performed at 250 concerts over two years and said he
will take some serious down-time.

He told his final show last week: "As you may or not know, I've been on the
Divide tour for over two years now and this is the last day of the whole thing.

"There is something very bittersweet about it. I love that you guys are here.
This is my last gig for probably 18 months."

headline: NEVER HAD TO MATURE
content_plain:
WHAT is a married 33-year-old man doing taking off his trousers in a Jacuzzi
with young girls? You might say he's just having fun but no woman wants her man
larking around late at night with another woman.

Jumping in a hot tub is inappropriate and nine out of ten times something will
happen, even if it didn't here.

Wayne has behaved so badly in the past he needs to be squeaky clean for his wife
to move on.

His problem is that he keeps getting into trouble when he has a drink. He simply
can't behave.

He's not matured because he's never had to worry about paying the bills. Coleen
is fiercely loyal and she will probably never leave him  but he needs to stop
disappointing her like this.

headline: F2 driver dies after car splits in smash
content_plain:
A YOUNG Formula Two driver was yesterday killed after a smash at the Belgian
Grand Prix.

French native Anthoine Hubert, 22, died following a 260kph collision at the
Spa-Francorchamps track.

A number of drivers were involved in the second-lap accident on the exit of the
fearsome Eau Rouge corner.

The official TV feed swiftly cut away from the scene and there were no replays
of the accident.

Footage which later emerged online appeared to show Hubert slamming into the
barriers on the side of the circuit before sliding across the track.

Racer Juan Manuel Correa then crashed head on into Hubert, whose car broke in
two.

The sport's governing body, the FIA, last night said: "He was kind to everyone,
always smiling, and his positive attitude was infectious. He will be dearly
missed."

headline: Wayne dropped 3 women showing trousers in front off tight blue boxers
subheadline:
1, 20191RM EXCLUSIVE: LIFT GIRL 1RM Sunday, September 1, 2019 ............... 9
ON 7HR BOOZE-UP WITH ACE 'HIS WIFE WOULD NOT BE HAPPY WITH JACUZZI STRIP'
content_plain:
htes A BRUNETTE pictured with Wayne Rooney in a hotel at 5.30am has told how he
earlier stripped to his pants in front of three women at a boozy Jacuzzi party.

tty hd Karra Granados, seen in last week's Irish Sun on Sunday getting in a
hotel lift with Rooney, said the footie star and four DC United team-mates all
stripped to their skivvies during a wild seven-hour night out.

l gse e Karra, 27, said: "Wayne took off his jeans and was dipping his feet in
the water. He joined in with everyone else. He had tight boxers on  they were
blue and I think they were Calvin Klein.'' She also told how Rooney and one
team-mate took her back to their hotel at 5.30am after the Jacuzzi party ended 
where the Manchester United legend fell asleep and she romped with his friend.

Karra added: "It was a crazy night  Wayne partied so hard with the others. It
was very intense. Everyone was going for it and Wayne was definitely letting his
hair down, joining in with everybody. He was in very good spirits.

"I think Wayne just wanted to feel like a normal guy on a night out, not a
famous person."

Karra told how she hooked up with Rooney, 33, and team-mates following a DC
United match in Vancouver on August 17.

She was with friends at nightclub Twelve West when they were given a VIP table
next to Rooney's group.

She said she poked fun at Rooney because he looked scruffy in a grey hoodie and
baseball cap.

Karra said: "I wasn't really paying attention to his party. But I almost spilled
a drink on one of them and we began chatting.

"I had no idea who Wayne Rooney was but someone mentioned that he was a famous
footballer."

While in the club Rooney, believed to be drinking rum and cokes, was pictured
deep in conversation with a second woman  a brunette wearing black leather
trousers. Pictures showed him putting his arms around her waist and her leaning
in closely to whisper in his ear.

Rooney later insisted the woman was "simply one of many who innocently asked for
autographs".

Karra, who did not know the woman, said: "They looked like they were quite
close, she was flirtatious.

"I didn't see her getting his autograph." Karra's account of that night fills in
a few details that Rooney omitted when he responded angrily on social media to
our story.

She told how the woman in the a te an Pierre's Champ picture was asked to join
her, Rooney and team-mates as they headed to another club, called Champagne
Lounge. After they all clambered into a limo, Rooney turned his attention
towards lawyer's assistant Karra.

She said: "Wayne's team-mate grabbed me by the hand and put me in the limo.

"He was pushing everyone in but there wasn't much room. Wayne said 'Come and sit
here next to me'.

"He put his arm around me.

The other girl was on the other side of the limo."

Once in Pierre's the other woman disappeared  and Karra found herself as the
only girl on Rooney's table as waiters brought them drinks.

After about an hour Karra, Rooney, two other women and four team-mates were
invited back to a barman's apartment.

It had a shared swimming pool and a Jacuzzi  which the group ended up using in
the early hours of the morning. Karra told how Rooney whipped off his jeans,
revealing blue Calvin Klein underpants, and dipped his legs into the water of
the Jacuzzi.

His team-mates also stripped to their underwear.

The two other women, friends of the barman, swam in the adjacent pool. Karra
said: "Wayne joined in with everyone else. He had tight boxers on.

"He kept his shirt on but his jeans got wet when they were laid out beside the
hot tub.

"When he put them back on it looked like he had p***** him-himself. I was making
fun of him about it."

At about 5.30am Rooney and one of his team-mates invited Karra with them back to
their hotel, the Hyatt Regency.

She said: "We went up in the lift together and all chatted for a bit. Then
Wayne, who just seemed absolutely exhausted, went to sleep."

Karra said she ended up kissing and cuddling the team-mate. She added: "I moved
over to his bed and we kissed.

"I was really tired so later I called a cab and went home."

Karra said she was devastated when she discovered the player she kissed was
married.

She added: "Nothing would have happened between us if I had known.

"Wayne was such a gentleman the whole time.

"But I'm not sure his wife would be happy to hear he stripped to his underpants
in a hot tub in front of women."

@IrishSunOnline

headline: Fly me to paradise
subheadline: TROPICAL ISLANDS ONCE OUT OF REACH ARE NOW ACCESSIBLE TO ALL
content_plain:
ISLAND-hopping has never been easier in the Philippines as internal flights for
as little as €15 connect these tropical paradises.

Once a destination exclusively for intrepid travellers and broke backpackers,
the Philippines is fast becoming a holiday haven for all.

An archipelago nation of pristine beaches with sugar-white sand and
cyan-coloured swells, the Philippines is still relatively undiscovered in
comparison to the rest of Southeast Asia.

Last year marked an unprecedented surge in visitor numbers, topping 7.1 million,
however these figures are minuscule to Thailand' who had 34.5 million tourists
visit.

Having wrestled with the crowds of Thailand and Bali, where throngs of Irish and
Brits now holiday, I was lured to the Philippines with promises of a calmer way
of life.

Beyond the crazed chaos of the Philippines cities lie over 7,000 islands, many
of which are uninhabited.

Until recent years, these idyllic isles were cut off from tourists, with limited
access it took days to reach a destination.

But now with Cebu Pacific opening up more flight paths to connect the many
islands of the Philippines, the country is easier than ever to travel around. I
took advantage of such flights and island-hopped through this beautiful country
for three weeks forking over as little as €15 per flight. Once cut-off corners
are now easily accessible, as well as improvements in both hospitality and
accommodation now make travelling the Philippines more appealing to more than
just the penny-pinching traveller.

I began my adventure around the Pearl of the Orient with a flight from Manilla
to Caticlan Airport, in Boracay. Boracay Beach has recently reopened after a
shock government closer. Dubbed a "cesspool" for its outdated and insufficient
sewerage plans, the powder-white beach is now restored to former glory thanks to
a mass clean-up and regeneration project.

Boracay is a great place to acclimate and recover from the jetlag (flight time
is approximately 17 hours from Dublin!).

White Beach, named appropriately so, is the go-to place for beachside
accommodation, with sand so dazzling it's almost impossible to look at it
without sunglasses.

FANGTASTIC...golden spider The beaches of the Philippines closely resemble the
famous Indian Ocean atolls, the Maldives, but at half the price.

With so much of this coral-reefed beauty to see, it's crucial to have a plan A
quick flight from Boracay to neighbouring island Cebu didn't break the bank at
€15, where I then hopped on a bus to the seaside town of Moalboal. The
spectacular sight of the sardine run as well as the gorgeous Kawasan Falls are
just some of the tourist draws to the sleepy fishing village.

Once a nature lover's most prized secret, Kawasan Falls is now one of the most
famous landmarks in the nation, thanks largely to social media.

Thousands visit the area every day, but I rose before sunrise, rented a scooter
and zipped off to the falls solo.

web Arriving shortly before 8am, I found the falls completely empty, with no
sound other than the splashing mountain water and the rustling treetops from the
monkeys above.

My next port of call was the island of Bohol, where I was rewarded for my long
day of travel once again with sights of flourwhite sand and glistening waters.
Top notch snorkel spots are a dime a peso here, with spotted sharks,
heavy-lidded turtles and curious cuttlefish populating the waters off Bohol's
Alona Beach.

The ocean isn't the only place where nature flourishes in the Philippines.
Meter-long monitor lizards, giant flying foxes and spiders the size of your palm
are all the norm in this tropical ecosystem.

On the slightly cuddlier side, the pocket-sized tarsier monkey flies the flag
for the less intimidating of the native wildlife.

The other-worldly underwater Mecca continued in the province of Palawan, an
island west of Cebu and accessible again, by a cheapas-chips flight.

This idyllic island, comprising of nearly 2,000 small surrounding islets, has
won Best Island in the World three years running.

Palawan first gained attention thanks to its feature in Hollywood blockbusters,
The Bourne Legacy and James Bond's The World Is Not Enough.

It is also rumoured that this rustic paradise was the true inspiration for Alex
Garland's The Beach.

El Nido, Coron and Port Barton are the places to be in Palawan, with their
towering mountains, limestone caves and turquoise lagoons. Unfortunately,
getting around Palawan is no easy feat and involves a lot of white-knuckle
driving.

Unless you're okay with slumming it in a van with a dozen or so backpackers,
winding through the hilltops for six hours, it is advised once again to board a
plane.

Flights from Puerto Princesa leave to every corner of Palawan daily, so save
yourself the hassle and book via Skyscanner.

Palawan is where I spent the majority of my time.

Each day was spent immersed with the convivial locals and Filipino culture.
Christianity is strong in the Philippines  80 per cent of the population is
Roman Catholic. This coulde be why I, being Irish, was greeted with wide smiles.

The Filipinos are welcoming, with English widely spoken, often with an American
twang in the cities.

Even the island children have a phrase or two, eager to learn as future income
depends on it. Tourism is crucial to the Philippines' economy, accounting for
11pc of its GDP.

I idled my time away exploring these majestic beaches and eating in seafront
restaurants. The cuisine, which is heavy on fresh seafood, is a melting pot of
international flavours.

You will never have to worry about your bank balance while in this pocket of the
world, with a locally cooked meal costing over average just €2.50.

Like Bohol, the seas surrounding Palawan are teeming with fish of every colour,
and iridescent blue starfish litter the seabed. Island tours are popular from El
Nido, where your traditional banca boat will weave in and out of secret lagoons.

At night, electricity and running water is limited on the island. As my time
came to an end, I wondered how I would sleep back home without the soundtrack of
a distant humming generator, lapping waves and squawking geckos.

 KEELIN RILEY GO: THE PHILIPPINES GETTNG THERE: Fly from Dublin for a little as
€619 with Turkish Airlines, Emirates, or Etihad or Qatar Airways.

TOUR: Hayes and Jarvis specialise in escorted tours and family holidays to the
Philippines. Trips include highlights of Manilla, Cebu, Bohol and more, a great
combination of city and island life for everyone.

See hayesandjarvis.ie/ holidays/philippines/ or pick up the phone and call them
on (01) 513 5156.

FIND OUT MORE: For more travel tips on the Philippines, visit travel blog
sun-scribes.com

headline: Kennedy assassin stabbed in prison
content_plain:
By JOHN HAND THE man jailed for more than 50 years for the 1968 assassination of
Robert F Kennedy, has been stabbed by an inmate at a San Diego prison.

Sirhan Sirhan, 75, was hospitalised on Friday after the incident at the Richard
J Donovan Correctional Facility.

A statement from the state Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation said:
"Officers responded quickly, and found an inmate with stab wound injuries. He
was transported to an outside hospital for medical care, and is currently in
stable condition."

Corrections officials reported that the alleged attacker has been identified and
has been segregated from the rest of the prison population pending an
investigation.

Sirhan was convicted of shooting US Senator Kennedy on June 5, 1968, in Los
Angeles' Ambassador Hotel.

headline: FREED LAG WRIGHT IS AN 'EXTREMELY DANGEROUS' BRUTE
subheadline:
............... THREAT TO THE PUBLIC OUT Gardai warned about violent thug's
release
content_plain:
GARDAI have been urged to "exercise extreme caution" when dealing with one of
Ireland's most dangerous criminals.

Notorious thug Leon Wright, 31, is back on the streets after walking free from
prison early on Friday.

The psycho had been serving a 13-year term for a string of violent offences.
Aside from his shocking attacks on the outside, the monster previously carried
out assaults on prison officers who were so wary of the brute they had to wear
riot gear when interacting with him.

Today the Irish Sun on Sunday can reveal Wright's release has sparked a major
Garda alert.

Officers have been warned Wright  whose rap sheet is littered with assault,
robbery, threats to kill and other shocking crimes  is "an extremely violent
individual".

Gardai were told Wright "does not react well to authority in any shape or form"
as cops were urged to "exercise extreme caution when dealing with him".

A special directive declared: "Assess all risk before engaging with Leon
Wright."

The Irish Sun on Sunday has learned Wright is currently staying in a half-way
house in the Coolock area of north Dublin.

The man dubbed Ireland's most dangerous inmate walked free from the Midlands
Prison in the early hours of Friday. Wright has more than 100 previous
convictions, including robberies, 34 assaults and firearms offences.

The crazed beast had been locked up in the Midlands Prison's National Violence
Reduction Unit  a €2.7m specialist facility designed to hold prisoners who have
a high propensity for extreme violence.

During his time inside, he has attacked dozens of prison officers and been
disciplined 212 times.

Prison bosses tried to curb Wright's violent outbursts, including giving him his
own punching bag to take his aggression out on.

He was also given a Playstation and a fish tank to pacify him.

But Wright attacked over two dozen guards while in jail and left many with
serious injuries, triggering the use of teams in riot gear for any interactions
with him.

The "very dangerous" serial offender was given a 13-year prison sentence in 2007
for a litany of violent crimes, including robbery, hijacking, assault and
threatening to kill gardai.

Wright stabbed a youth in the leg during a robbery at Stephen's Green and at a
later date hijacked two cars from women shopping at Liffey Valley.

In another incident he was involved in a 15-minute stand-off with gardai in
Lucan while armed with a knife, and threatening to go into a house and kill the
occupants. He also violently resisted arrest in Skerries, Co Dublin, where he
spat at, tried to bite and grabbed the testicles of a garda. He physically
attacked cops at the Children's Court, and threatened to shoot one in the head.

Defence counsel said Wright faced "extreme" difficulties and had very serious
problems.

Sentencing the terror teen at the time, Judge Michael White considered health
service, probation, psychiatric and risk-assessment reports on Wright and
suggested he was a "very high risk of reoffending".

One report described Wright as dangerous both to himself and the public, with an
anger so great it was uncontrollable.

In 2014, Wright was jailed for four years for stabbing two men in random attacks
in Dublin city centre in April 2013.

Wright had been on bail for assaulting two gardai when he knifed a Mauritian
national on Grafton Street and a man walking with a female companion on Chatham
Row minutes later.

Wright, who appeared in court handcuffed and flanked by five prison staff in
riot gear, told gardai he'd been aiming for the second victim's organs in the
attack. He claimed he had tried to kill the man, "but his bird got in the way".

The thug, of Teresa's Gardens, Donore Avenue, south inner city Dublin, pleaded
guilty at Dublin Circuit Criminal Court to attempted robbery and assault of
Harisikashra Rajaysur outside Burger King, Grafton Street, on April 16, 2013.

He pleaded guilty to assaulting Killian Byrne and Karolina Dryzaite and to
robbing a purse and its contents at Chatham Row on the same date. He also
pleaded guilty to assaulting Garda Denise Bowes and former Reserve Garda Rachel
Finlay on Abbey Street on January 23, 2013.

Sentencing him, Judge Mary Ellen Ring commented that the psychiatrist's report
made for "disturbing reading".

When describing the first attack, Wright had said: "I just picked a fight with a
fella and took out a knife and stabbed him."

He said he had been in a "bad head space" and under the influence of tablets.
Wright apologised to his victims in later interviews and revealed he had wanted
to hurt himself as he was sick of life.

Independent TD Mick Wallace has previously turned up in court to support
volatile Wright.

Deputy Wallace and fellow Independent Clare Daly attended a court case in 2016
in which Wright was cleared of assaulting a prisoner officer.

The Wexford TD later claimed the notorious prisoner's human rights were being
violated. In a statement on his Facebook page Wallace stated: "People are sent
to prison as punishment, not for punishment."

He said he was "motivated by a desire for a safer environment for prisoners,
staff and society at large".

@gmeneely

headline: Freeman: My 2 kids prefer the US Office
content_plain:
Freeman says his kids prefer the US version of the hit telly comedy.

Martin, 47, found fame as wise-cracking sales rep Tim Canterbury opposite Ricky
Gervais in the original which started in 2001 on BBC2.

It ran for two series while the US version, starring Steve Carell, ran for nine
from 2005 to 2013. Martin says kids Joe, 13, and Grace, ten, enjoy it more.

Martin, who plays Watson in Sherlock, said: "Do you know what they like? The
American version of The Office.

"After I played Tim, I was in Love, Actually.

"I could honestly say at that point, 'I'm in a number one film in America and
Britain.' "Great, I could retire on that. That's something to tell your kids.

"But they don't give a s**t. They're texting."

headline: As workplace bonds strengthen, you [...]
content_plain:
As workplace bonds strengthen, you take a place in a team - even if it doesn't
seem like the place you want to be. New sides of you begin to emerge and secret
skills are uncovered. In love? A partnership moon opens two hearts to big
changes. Single? You'll find a new love interest is an expert in healthy eating.

Make sure you find time for fun in the coming week. As your creativity revs up,
your unusual take on the world hits the right audience. Your work ideas are
genius - screens and dreams make a perfect match in more ways than one. As the
planets of passion and protection join, love finds a future-proof pattern.

Walking on the lighter side of life restores emotional balance, so you'll be
able to see who could be good for you. This week, power-planet bonds help you to
reboot tricky partnerships. Meanwhile, your moon path is part "just do it", part
dreamy, so people may not realise your strength until you end up in charge.

You will build brilliant bonds if you focus on communication. But be sure to
always stay true to yourself, so connections begin and stay genuine. Names that
share a special date are ready to start an important planning process. Your
memory zone is moon-intense and a significant journey is back on.

Hiding feelings, even for the best reasons, is not a solution to a problem.
Instead, follow your heart and find a way to speak about emotions to reset a key
relationship. In the next few days, so much of your chart is about finding and
rewarding value. This helps you overhaul everything, from love bonds to career
aims.

Your chart shows a contrast between high-profile planets in your sign and the
gentle moon lighting up how you feel and what to do about it - so you're the
centre of attention. A leading work role is perfect for you and you learn new
skills super-fast. In love, going with the flow sets some big feelings free.

Start September with clear decisions about cash, love or time. You have a new
sense of belief in yourself, and a fresh vision for the future can appear. Luck
sparkles around words, but you will also find it in how open you are to sharing
your dreams with others. In love, pure happiness links to an unexpected L name.

The people you surround yourself with matter so much right now, and instead of
waiting for a family member to call, you should make the first move. At work,
one group can become two and achieve more. A casual bond has the chance to
become serious - but only if you switch off that doubting inner voice.

Your success sector is shining with planet potential and you pursue goals with a
deep sense of purpose. Meanwhile, if you've been seeking approval in a
relationship, it's time to stop and set your own rules and limits for romance.
Your Jupiter prize sensors are super-sharp, so you will select contests well.

Your ability to learn in life and love tops all the zodiac signs in the coming
days. Intuition gives you a heads-up when making snap decisions or finalising
key documents, but best of all you find you won't be held back by the dreams or
opinions of others. Meanwhile, a name heard several times is your best love
clue.

When you allow yourself to cut loose from tight schedules or expectations, you
will make time for something special. And yes, you'll be ready. At the moment
your growth and personal change is powered by the planets, which makes you the
best version of yourself. Saturn helps you stick to a secret promise.

You are ready to transform a part-time connection into something that sits
firmly in your favour. What may first feel like a problem develops into an
exciting challenge. Numbers that start with seven and names that remind you of
holidays are very lucky. Elsewhere, a caring moon leads you to a local charity.

headline: Tommy has had a huge impact...he's born winner
content_plain:
TOMMY WALSH is a "born winner" who can halt Dublin's Drive for Five if given the
chance.

That is the verdict of his former team-mate and namesake Donnchadh Walsh, who
has fancied Kerry to push the Dubs all the way since Peter Keane took over as
senior boss.

He never did get to play under the hugely-successful minor manager, who took
over from Éamonn Fitzmaurice for the start of the season.

The 35-year-old retired from he inter-county stage last winter after 15 years of
senior service in the green and gold.

But he admits the players who came in to replace him and fellow retiree Kieran
Donaghy have improved the team.

The Cromane man has three Celtic Crosses, eight Munster crowns and two NFL
Division 1 titles and there is much he misses about the whole set-up.

He laughed: "Not so much the hard training in November and December. But yeah,
on a week like this you would miss a build-up to an All-Ireland final."

Walsh forged a reputation as a non-stop running machine, adept at making
turnovers and then popping up at the other end for crucial scores.

But injury ravaged the physiotherapist's final season, restricting him to just a
substitute appearance against Galway in the Super 8 loss in Croke Park.

As he was leaving the panel, he could not help but be enthused about the crop of
young talent coming through the ranks.

But he reckons that, while Kerry's young rookies will test Dublin today, it
could be another veteran who is the key.

While flying half-forward Donnchadh left the group, Tommy, 31, returned to the
Kerry panel after 2½ years away.

He had won an All-Ireland title in 2009 but then departed for the AFL, playing
with St Kilda and Sydney Swans before returning to Ireland in 2014.

But injuries hampered the towering forward's efforts to force his way into
Fitzmaurice's plans and he ultimately left the squad following the 2016 NFL.

But on the back of a sterling club championship last season with Kerins
O'Rahillys, Keane called him into the fold.

And in the past two games  against Tyrone and Meath  he has had quite the
impact.

His old pal said: "Seeing Tommy back is just fantastic. It's like a second
comeback.

"He's bringing that bit of seniority to the panel.

"He's bringing that experience. He's an All-Ireland winner, he's an
ex-professional athlete, and he knows the culture.

"His father played for Kerry for years, he knows what it means to be a Kerry
footballer and he knows what it means to be a Kerry fan because he's been doing
that for the last number of years. He'll be a great head in the dressing room.

"We saw him a lot at the start of the year when the advanced mark rule was
brought in for the league.

"After that we didn't see so much of him and we were kind of wondering what the
story was. But in the last two games he has had a huge impact. It's been great
to see. He is just a fantastic footballer.

"Getting back in the team won't keep Tommy happy  he is a born winner. He will
want to win again with Kerry."

From the start of the year, Donnchadh has backed Kerry to be there at the
business end of the season. In January, he suggested they were the only team
capable of stopping Dublin.

He added: "I always thought Kerry would be the only team that can put it up to
Dublin.

"I didn't see any of the other teams beating them.

"But it's very easy to say that. They still have to go out and win it. And that
won't be easy. Dublin are an unreal team.

"I just felt that if anyone was going to stop Dublin doing the five in a row it
could be Kerry. While I was in there with them I saw enough of what Kerry could
do when they're on form.

"I don't think  and I include myself in this  what Kerry lost with the
retirements was irreplaceable. The talent was there to replace the fellas gone,
if not improve on it."

Walsh is still as busy as ever. He was in demand with the media this week,
taking part in a GAA NOW show.

Each weekend he travels home to Cromane to represent his club. Still playing
there is another ex-Kerry star  the rangy wingforward, Seán O'Sullivan. Walsh
says he owes his club a lot and does not mind the travelling.

He also hailed Keane for building on the excellent culture that Fitzmaurice had
created in the group.

He said: "Peter is doing a fine job and I admire him for putting his own stamp
on the squad.

"There is a huge foundation for any young talented player to absolutely grow and
mature into a fullyfledged All-Ireland winner. "Peter has completely freshened
it up and they have trained hard. That's what was needed, they have just gone at
it."

headline: We never changed approach for Bohs

AARON GREENE revealed Shamrock Rovers' secret to breaking their Gypsy curse was

The Hoops got their first win over Bohemians since May 2017 on Friday night as
Graham Burke's header ended a run of seven losses and a draw against the
Gypsies.

Greene only returned to his hometown Hoops in July 2018 and has been involved in
the last four defeats, three of them this season when little went Rovers' way.

The first two derbies saw the Hoops pick up three red cards and concede two

The third was won by a Danny Mandroiu wonder goal after the player had scored

And Greene revealed that boss Stephen Bradley prepared the team the exact same

The striker said: "There has been a lot about the game in the media but as

headline: CROKES ARE SHOVLIN IT
content_plain:
BEN SHOVLIN fired Kilmacud Crokes into seventh heaven.

Shovlin netted a fifthminute goal as the host club beat Down side An Riocht by
1-11 to 1-9 in the Londis All-Ireland Football Sevens final last night.

Johnny Magee's team remarkably registered all of their scores from play,
including efforts from the wing by Dan O'Brien, and Niall O'Leary.

Crokes led by 1-6 to 0-5 at half-time, with Deaglan Morgan and Ronan Campbell
keeping An Riocht in touch.

Keeper Pádraig Purcell extended the lead on the restart with the second of his
three points. In their first final, An Riocht battled hard and grabbed an
injury-time goal from Morgan to cut the gap to two points.

The Down outfit continued to cause Crokes problems as they searched for a
winner.

However, O'Brien produced a well-timed block late on to seal a sixth crown for
Crokes as Karl Dias lifted the Cup.

Afterwards, Crokes' Cillian O'Shea was named the Londis Player of the
Tournament. SCORERS  Kilmacud Crokes: B Shovlin 1-1; N O'Leary 0-3, P Purcell
0-3; D O'Brien 0-2, D Jones 0-2. An Riocht: D Morgan 1-3; R Campbell 0-4, 1f; C
Clarke 0-1, M O'Rourke 0-1.

headline: WEXFORD and their fans went [...]
content_plain:
WEXFORD and their fans went Dancing at the Crossroads.

The Models ended a 28-year as Tom Dempsey (below) scored a goal that made the
difference in a 1-13 to 0-14 All-Ireland SHC final victory over Limerick.

It was no classic. But despite Eamonn Scallan's red card, Damien Fitzhenry, Liam
Dunne and Co held on for Wexford's sixth All-Ireland. They've been in six
semi-finals since but no final.

Their name-checking 'Dancing at the Crossroads' song remains one of the more
iconic GAA tunes.

Not so good was their captain's speech about them always being the bridesmaids
and finally getting married.

What's the story, Martin Storey?
